Solve the linear system
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
3x & - & y & - & z & = & 4 \\
x & + & 5y & + & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(x,\,x,\,-2x+1\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(\frac{5}{4},\,y,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
2x & + & y & + & z & - & t & = & 0 \\
x & - & 2y & - & z & + & 2t & = & 1 \\
x & + & y & + & z & - & t & = & 0
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\left(0,\,y,\,0,\,1+y\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,0,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(0,\,y,\,0,\,z\right)$ as solutions for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question:
Consider the differentiable function $f:\mathbb{R}^{2}\backslash \left\{\left( 0,0\right) \right\} \rightarrow \mathbb{R},$ $f(x,y)=\dfrac{1}{2}\ln\left( x^{2}+y^{2}\right) .$ 

Find $df \left( 1,2\right) $ and $d^{2}f\left(1,2\right)$.

Find the solution of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
&x &+ &y &+ &z &= &0 \\ 
&-x &- &y &+ &2z &= &0 \\ 
&3x &- &y &- &5z &= &0
\end{cases}$$
answer3:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter:
$$(3+z,2-2z,z),\, \forall z\in \mathbb{R}$$.
answer4:
The system has infinitely many solutions depending on two parameter:
$$(3+z+y,y,z),\, \forall y,z\in \mathbb{R}$$.

question:
Ralph Edmund loves steaks and potatoes. Therefore, he has decided to go on a steady diet of only these two foods (plus some liquids and vitamin supplements) for all his meals. Ralph realizes that this isn't the healthiest diet, so he wants to make sure that he eats the right quantities of the two foods to satisfy some key nutritional requirements. He has obtained the following nutritional and cost information:

\[
\begin{array}{|l|c|c|c|}
\hline
%& \multicolumn{2}{c|}{Grams of ingredient per serving} &\\
\text{Ingredient} & \text{Steak (gr. per serving)} & \text{Potatoes (gr. per serving)} & \text{Daily Requirements (gr.)} \\
\hline
\text{Carbohydrates} & 5 & 15 & \geq 50 \\
\text{Protein} & 20 & 5 & \geq 40 \\
\text{Fat} & 15 & 2 & \leq 60 \\
\hline
\text{Cost per serving} & 4 & 2 &  \\
\hline
\end{array}
\]

In this situation, what are the decision variables to formalize the Linear Programming (LP) model that allows planning the Ralph's diet?
answer1: $x_{i}$ is the number of daily servings of food $i$ ($i=1$, for steak and $i=2$, for potatoes)
answer2: $x$ is the number of daily servings of food
answer3: $x_{1}$ is the number of daily servings of potatoes
answer4: $x_{2}$ is the number of daily servings of steak

A quadrilateral is a rectangle when
answer1: all four internal angles are congruent.
answer2: it has congruent internal angles two by two OR it has two pairs of congruent internal angles.
answer3: it has congruent sides two by two OR it has two pairs of congruent sides.
answer4: it has parallel sides two by two OR it has two pairs of parallel sides.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & - & z & - & t & = & 1\\
x & - & 2y & + & 3z & + & t &  = & 1\\
x & - & y & + & 3z & + & t & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1-z,\,0,\,z,\,-2z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,0,\,0,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(1-z,\,0,\,z,\,-2z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}\setminus\{0\}$.

question: Solving an integer programming problem by rounding off answers obtained by solving it as a linear programming problem (using simplex), it is possible to conclude that
answer1: the value of the objective function for a maximization problem will likely be less than the simplex solution.
answer2: the values of decision variables obtained by rounding off are always very close to the optimal values.
answer3: the value of the objective function for a minimization problem will likely be less than the simplex solution.

A preserved fruit company owns two factories ($j$). The fruit can be provided by three producers ($j$) under the following conditions: producer A sells 200 tonne at 10 u.m. per tonne, producer B sells 300 tonne at 9 u.m. per tonne and Producer C sells 400 tonne at 8 u.m. per tonne.

The transportation costs (u.m./tonne) between each factory and producer are the following:
	\[
\begin{array}{l|cc|}
 & \text{Factory 1} & \text{Factory 2} \\
\hline
\text{Producer A} & 2  & 2.5 \\
\text{Producer B} & 1 & 1.5\\
\text{Producer C} &5  & 3 \\
\hline 
\end{array}
\]	

The capacities of the factories as well as the cost of labor are the following:
	\[
\begin{array}{l|cc|}
& \text{Factory 1} & \text{Factory 2} \\
\hline
\text{Capacity (tonne)} & 450  & 550 \\
\text{Cost of labor (u.m./tonne)} & 25 & 20 \\
\hline 
\end{array}
\]

Consider the linear operator $F:\mathbb{R}^2 \longrightarrow \mathbb{R}^2$ such that $F(x,y)=(x+2y,2x+3y)$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $F^{-1}$ is a symmetric operator defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(-3x+2y, 2x-y)$
answer3: $F^{-1}$ is defined by $F^{-1}(x,y)=(3x-2y, -2x+y)$ and is not a symmetric operator

question:
For which values of $a,b,c\in\mathbb{R}$ the following linear system has no solutions?
$$\left\{\begin{array}{cccccccc}
3x & - & y & + & 2z & = & a\\
-x & + & 2y & - & 3z & = & b\\
x & + & 2y & + & z & = & c
\end{array}\right.$$
answer1: There is no $(a,b,c)\in\mathbb{R}^{3}$ for which the linear system has no solutions.

$$\begin{cases}
3x & + & 2y & - & z & + & 2t & = & 1\\
x & - & y & + &2 z & - & 4t & = & -1\\
-x & - & 2y & - & z & + & t & = & 0\\
2x & + & 3y & - & 2z & + & t & = & 2
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has a unique solution.
answer3: The system has infinitely many solutions depending on one parameter.

Find the solutions $\left(\text{in } \mathbb{C}^2\right)$ of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
z &- &iw &= &1 \\
iz &- &w &= &1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\bigg(\frac{1-i}{2},\frac{-1+i}{2}\bigg)$ as unique solution.
answer3: The system has $(z,-iz)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{C}$.
answer4: The system has $\bigg(\frac{1-i}{2},\frac{1+i}{2}\bigg)$ as unique solution.

question: Assume that $F$ and $H$ are subspaces of a finite-dimensional vector space $V$. Choose the true statement.
answer1: If $F$ is a zero vector space, then $dim(F)= 0$
answer4: If a set of $n$ vectors spans the subspace $H$, then $dim(H)=n$

question:
Solve the linear system
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & + & z & = & 1 \\
3x & - & y & - & z & = & 4 \\
x & + & 5y & + & 5z & = & -1
\end{cases}$$
answer2: The system has $\left(0,\,0,\,1\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer3: The system has $\left(x,\,x,\,-2x+1\right)$ as solution for every $x\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer4: The system has $\left(\frac{5}{4},\,y,\,z\right)$ as solution for every $y,z\in\mathbb{R}$.

question: Indicate which of the following set of vectors is a spanning set of $\mathbb{R}^2$.
Consider, in $\mathbb{R}^3$, the plane $\pi: x+2y-z=0$ and the lines $r: x-2=-y=2-z$ and $s: \dfrac{x-1}{2}= \dfrac{y-1}{3}=\dfrac{z-3}{2}$. Choose the true statement:
answer3: $\pi$ does not contain any of the lines $r$ and $s$.

Consider the subsets  $\displaystyle A=\{(1, 1, 1), (0, 1, 1), (1, 2, 3)\}$ and $\displaystyle B=\left\{(1, 1, 1), \left(-\frac{2}{3}, \frac{1}{3}, \frac{1}{3}\right), \left(0, -\frac{1}{2}, \frac{1}{2}\right)\right\}$ of $\mathbb{R}^3$. Choose the right answer:
answer1: $B$ is an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$ but $A$ isn't an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer2: $A$ is an orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$ but $B$ isn't an orhtogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer3: $A$ and $B$ are both orthogonal basis of of $\mathbb{R}^3$
answer4: $A$ and $B$ are both non-orthogonal basis of $\mathbb{R}^3$

question: Indicate which of the following set of vectors is a spanning set of $\mathbb{R}^2$.

Find the solutions of the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & y & - & z & - & t & = & 1\\
x & - & 2y & + & 3z & + & t &  = & 1\\
x & - & y & + & 3z & + & t & = & 1
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The system has $\left(1-z,\,0,\,z,\,-2z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,0,\,0,\,0\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(1-z,\,0,\,z,\,-2z\right)$ as solution for every $z\in\mathbb{R}\setminus\{0\}$.

question: Indicate which of the following is not a subspace of $M_{n\times n}$.
answer1: The set of all $n\times n$ matrices $A$ such $det(A)=0$.
answer2: The set of all diagonal $n\times n$ matrices.
answer3: The set of all  $n\times n$ matrices $A$ such $a_{ii}=0$ for every $i=1,...,n$.
answer4: The set of all $n\times n$ matrices $A$ such $A^T=A$.

2x & + & y & + & z & - & t & = & 0 \\
x & - & 2y & - & z & + & 2t & = & 1 \\
x & + & y & + & z & - & t & = & 0

answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\left(0,\,y,\,0,\,1+y\right)$ for every $y\in\mathbb{R}$.
